item.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
item.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco. Don't ask.

item.name: Ancestral Healing
item.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
item.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

item.name: Animal Companion
item.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer! Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

item.name: Arcane Explosion
item.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
item.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

item.name: Arcane Intellect
item.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER. And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

item.name: Arcane Missiles
item.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among enemy characters.
item.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

item.name: Arcane Shot
item.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves. The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

item.name: Arcanite Reaper
item.flavor: Noâ€¦ actually you should fear the Reaper.

item.name: Archmage
item.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

item.name: Assassin's Blade
item.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin. Certificate of authenticity included.

item.name: Assassinate
item.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

item.name: Avatar of the Coin
item.text: You lost the coin flip, but gained a friend.

item.name: Backstab
item.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
item.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

item.name: Blessing of Kings
item.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

item.name: Blessing of Might
item.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

item.name: Bloodfen Raptor
item.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary

item.name: Bloodlust
item.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

item.name: Bluegill Warrior
item.flavor: He just wants a hug. A sloppy... slimy... hug.

item.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
item.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

item.name: Boulderfist Ogre
item.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

item.name: Charge
item.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
item.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

item.name: Chillwind Yeti
item.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

item.name: Claw
item.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
item.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

item.name: Claws
item.text: Your hero has +1 Attack this turn.

item.name: Cleave
item.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
item.flavor: Hey you twoâ€¦could you stand next to each other for a secondâ€¦

item.text: Going second makes your first minion stronger.
item.name: Coin's Vengeance

item.text: Going second makes your first minion stronger.
item.name: Coin's Vengence
Consecration
item.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy. But it smells a little, too.

item.name: Core Hound
item.flavor: You donâ€™t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

item.name: Corruption
item.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
item.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM! Corrupted!

item.name: Corruption
item.text: At the start of the corrupting player's turn, destroy this minion.

item.name: Dalaran Mage
item.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

item.name: Darkscale Healer
item.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
item.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time. It's more of a hobby really.

item.name: Deadly Poison
item.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells. Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison? Poison Elemental? Nobody wants that.

item.name: Divine Spirit
item.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

item.name: Dragonling Mechanic
item.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

item.name: Drain Life
item.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
item.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

item.name: Dread Infernal
item.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
item.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

item.name: Elven Archer
item.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date. She'll shoot you down.

item.text: Raid Leader is granting this minion +1 Attack.
item.name: Enhanced
Excess Mana
item.text: Draw a card. (You can only have 10 Mana in your tray.)

item.name: Execute
item.flavor: It's okay, he deserved it.

item.name: Eye In The Sky
item.text: Leokk is granting this minion +1 Attack.

item.name: Fan of Knives
item.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
item.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

item.name: Fiery War Axe
item.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

item.name: Fire Elemental
item.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

item.name: Fireball
item.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things. If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

item.name: Flamestrike
item.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
item.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

item.name: Flametongue Totem
item.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems. There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

item.name: Frost Nova
item.flavor: Hey man, that's cold. Literally and metaphorically.

item.name: Frost Shock
item.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.
item.flavor: FROST SHOCK!

item.name: Frostbolt
item.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
item.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

item.name: Frostwolf Grunt
item.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that. It's more than just a job.

item.name: Frostwolf Warlord
item.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
item.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley. Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

item.name: Furious Howl
item.text: This Beast has +1 Attack from Timber Wolf.

item.name: Gnomish Inventor
item.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

item.name: Goldshire Footman
item.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

item.name: Grimscale Oracle
item.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs. It turns out that doesnâ€™t mean much.

item.name: Guardian of Kings
item.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so clichÃ©!

item.name: Gurubashi Berserker
item.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.
item.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.

item.name: Hammer of Wrath
item.flavor: A good paladin has many tools. Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

item.name: Hand of Protection
item.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins donâ€™t know what it should be called anymore.

item.name: Healing Totem
item.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to all friendly minions.

item.name: Healing Touch
item.flavor: 8 Health, no waiting.

item.name: Hellfire
item.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

item.name: Heroic Strike
item.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

item.name: Hex
item.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
item.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

item.name: Holy Light
item.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

item.name: Holy Nova
item.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
item.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell. Also, you're probably a jerk.

item.name: Holy Smite
item.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are. Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

item.name: Houndmaster
item.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks. It's rhetorical.

item.name: Humility
item.flavor: This card makes something really damp. Oh wait. That's "Humidity."

item.name: Hunter's Mark
item.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

item.name: Innervate
item.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
item.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

item.name: Ironbark Protector
item.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

item.name: Ironforge Rifleman
item.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"

item.name: Ironfur Grizzly
item.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"

item.name: Kill Command
item.text: Deal $3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.
item.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.

item.name: Kobold Geomancer
item.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

item.name: Kor'kron Elite
item.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

item.name: Life Tap
item.text: Hero Power Draw a card and take 2 damage.

item.name: Light's Justice
item.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

item.name: Lord of the Arena
item.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

item.text: Going second grants you increased Health.
item.name: Luck of the Coin
Magma Rager
item.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

item.name: Mark of the Wild
item.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
item.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

item.name: Mind Blast
item.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
item.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

item.name: Mind Control
item.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
item.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

item.name: Mind Vision
item.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
item.flavor: I see what you did there.

item.name: Mirror Image
item.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

item.name: Moonfire
item.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

item.name: Mortal Coil
item.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
item.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

item.name: Multi-Shot
item.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.
item.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.

item.name: Murloc Raider
item.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

item.name: Murloc Tidehunter
item.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

item.name: Nightblade
item.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

item.name: NOOOOOOOOOOOO
item.text: Somehow, the card you USED to have has been deleted. Here, have this one instead!
item.flavor: Even your flavor text has been deleted. Dang.

item.name: Northshire Cleric
item.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
item.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed. Also they sell cookies.

item.name: Novice Engineer
item.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduateâ€¦ since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

item.name: Oasis Snapjaw
item.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

item.name: Ogre Magi
item.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

item.name: Polymorph
item.text: This minion has been transformed into a 1/1 Sheep.

item.name: Polymorph
item.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
item.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

item.name: Power Word: Shield
item.text: Give a minion +2 Health. Draw a card.
item.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

item.name: Raid Leader
item.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"

item.name: Razorfen Hunter
item.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once. ONCE.

item.name: Reckless Rocketeer
item.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer. One Rocket full of Explosives. Infinite Fun.

item.name: Reinforce
item.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

item.name: River Crocolisk
item.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

item.name: Rockbiter Weapon
item.text: This character has +3 Attack this turn.

item.name: Rockbiter Weapon
item.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

item.name: Sacrificial Pact
item.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
item.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

item.name: Sap
item.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
item.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

item.name: Savage Roar
item.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
item.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze". It's probably not that, though.

item.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
item.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

item.name: Shadow Bolt
item.flavor: Itâ€™s a Bolt. Its made out of Shadow. What more do you need to know!

item.name: Shadow Word: Death
item.text: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 5 or more.
item.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

item.name: Shadow Word: Pain
item.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
item.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

item.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
item.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drinkâ„¢!

item.name: Shield Block
item.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

item.name: Shiv
item.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

item.name: Silverback Patriarch
item.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

item.name: Sinister Strike
item.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
item.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off. Sinister, even.

item.name: Soulfire
item.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.
item.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

item.name: Sprint
item.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.

item.name: Starfire
item.flavor: Balance is important to druids. This card is perfectly balanced.

item.name: Starving Buzzard
item.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
item.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

item.name: Steady Shot
item.text: Hero Power Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

item.name: Stonetusk Boar
item.flavor: This card is boaring.

item.name: Stormpike Commando
item.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts. They also bake a mean cupcake.

item.name: Stormwind Champion
item.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

item.name: Stormwind Knight
item.flavor: They're still embarassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

item.name: Succubus
item.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.

item.name: Swipe
item.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
item.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe! ... or hug.

item.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
item.name: The Coin
Timber Wolf
item.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

item.name: Totemic Might
item.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

item.name: Tracking
item.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
item.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

item.name: Truesilver Champion
item.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
item.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

item.name: Tundra Rhino
item.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos. Or am I mistaken?

item.name: Vanish
item.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

item.name: Voidwalker
item.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

item.name: Voodoo Doctor
item.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

item.name: War Golem
item.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them. Instinct, maybe? A desire to blend in?

item.name: Warsong Commander
item.text: Whenever you summon a minion with 3 or less Attack, give it Charge.
item.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

item.name: Water Elemental
item.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
item.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party. It'll dampen the mood.

item.name: Whirlwind
item.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

item.name: Wild Growth
item.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

item.name: Windfury
item.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

item.name: Windspeaker
item.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

item.name: Wolfrider
item.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.
